message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The blue-red papule suggests a glomus tumor, which arises from modified smooth muscle cells. Rest of the options are not associated with the development of glomus tumor.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The blue-red color and extreme tenderness suggest the lesion is a glomus tumor, which arises from modified smooth muscle cells surrounding the vessels of the glomus body. Dysplastic melanocytes would suggest a melanoma, injured nerve cells would suggest a neuroma, and basal epidermal cells would suggest a basal cell carcinoma - all of which do not fit the clinical presentation in this case.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The blue-red papule and the location under the thumb suggest the lesion to be a glomus tumor, which arises from modified smooth muscle cells. None of the other cell types listed are associated with this type of lesion. The pitted and cracked thumbnail is likely a secondary result of the lesion.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The blue-red papule is most likely a glomus tumor, which develops from modified smooth muscle cells within the glomus body. Dysplastic melanocytes would suggest melanoma, injured nerve cells would suggest neuroma, and basal epidermal cells would suggest basal cell carcinoma, none of which are consistent with the presentation described in the question.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The blue-red papule under the thumbnail, along with the tenderness and pitted/cracked nail, suggests that the lesion is a glomus tumor. Glomus tumors arise from modified smooth muscle cells within the glomus body. None of the other options are associated with glomus tumors.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The presentation with a blue-red papule, tenderness, and pitted and cracked thumbnail suggests a glomus tumor, a rare benign neoplasm that originates from modified smooth muscle cells of the glomus body. None of the other options are consistent with this presentation.

We refer to a dermatology textbook for help. The description of the lesion is consistent with a glomus tumor, which arises from modified smooth muscle cells. None of the other options are associated with glomus tumors.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The blue-red papule, tenderness, and nail changes all suggest glomus tumor, which arises from modified smooth muscle cells. The other options are unlikely to cause this presentation.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The blue-red papule and the fact that the lesion worsens with exposure to cold temperatures suggest a diagnosis of glomus tumor. Glomus tumors are derived from modified smooth muscle cells, therefore the correct answer is (B). None of the other options are associated with glomus tumors.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The blue-red papule, tenderness, pitted and cracked thumbnail suggest a diagnosis of glomus tumor, which originates from modified smooth muscle cells called glomus cells. None of the other options are associated with glomus tumor.
